info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 6:35AM EDT until July 19 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Indiana...
Blue River at Fredericksburg affecting Washington and Harrison Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past several days has led to the river rising.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Blue River at Fredericksburg.
* WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water covers parts of Fredericksburg-Depauw Road near river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 7.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 8.6 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1245 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING
